review.title: Genetic Optimization of Keywords Subset in the Classification Analysis of Texts Authorship
review.abstract: The genetic selection of keywords set, the text frequencies of which are considered as attributes in text classification analysis, has been analyzed. The genetic optimization was performed on a set of words, which is the fraction of the frequency dictionary with given frequency limits. The frequency dictionary was formed on the basis of analyzed text array of texts of English fiction. As the fitness function which is minimized by the genetic algorithm, the error of nearest k neighbors classifier was used. The obtained results show high precision and recall of texts classification by authorship categories on the basis of attributes of keywords set which were selected by the genetic algorithm from the frequency dictionary.

metadata.title: Genetic Optimization of Keywords Subset in the Classification Analysis of Texts Authorship

sections.text: 1 The analysis of the authorship of texts occupies an important place in data mining. In the classification and cluster analysis of textual data, the vector model of text documents is widely used, where these documents are represented as vectors in a phase space [Pantel and Turney, 2010]. The text frequency of words forms the basis of this space. An important task is to find the optimal vector subspaces of documents for the classification and cluster analysis of text documents [Sebastiani, 2002; Forman, 2003]. The problem lies in particular in the selection of keywords whose text frequency can be used as input parameters for text classifiers with satisfactory precision. Solving this problem optimizes the required number of calculations and the precision of a classifier in data mining. Various parameters are used in the classification analysis to determine the classification potential of each word.

sections.heading: Summary and Conclusions
sections.text: The paper describes the genetic optimization of keywords whose frequency is the component of document vectors that function as attributes in text classification analysis.The genetic optimization was performed on the basis of the volume of words that represents the fraction of the frequency dictionary with predefined frequency boundaries.The frequency dictionary was formed on the basis of analyzed text arrangements of English fiction. As a fitness function, which is minimized by the genetic algorithm, the error of the classifier of the nearest k neighbors was used.The results obtained show high precision and recall of text classification by author categories based on several attributes of keywords selected from the frequency dictionary by the genetic algorithm.
